ComicInfo.Penciller: Bob Brown,Curt Swan,Leonard Starr,Morris Waldinger,Raymond Perry,Will Ely,Bob Brown,Bill Ely,Leonard Starr,Curt Swan,Morris Waldinger
ComicInfo.Summary:
The Crimes of the Black Cat: Joe Palmer is the last survivor of a robbers' gang. When his boss' black cat Damascus starts killing off the jurors who sentenced him to death and comes for him, Palmer is frightened and tries to get rid of the beast. But bullets can't do no harm, because the police staged the whole affair - to make Palmer confess his crimes.
The Melody of Death: Alex Breska runs a diner and worships Egyptian death god Anubis in his back room. A trio of be-bop musicians annoys his ears. They come for breakfast and start pulling Breskaâ€™s leg. He warns them to play his Egyptian notes, because they will profane the holy music. The boppers start jamming, turn into mummies and die.
I Hired a Ghost!: Jason Hawley wears the cursed Malayan "moonstone" to a Halloween party. A demonic figure appears, chases Hawley through the house, but falls to his death. It was Hawley's manservant Weems, trying to rob the precious jewel.
The Case of the Deadly Dolls: Ingenious doll maker Mr. Coner fabricates dolls of people who die shortly afterwards. Investigating lieutenant Farragut finally detects a pattern and arrests the doll maker.
Black Magic!: The "deathbone" curse of the Australian bushmen.
The Tree of Death!: The tree of Edgewell is connected to the lives of the Dalhousie clan.
Bells and Noises!: The tolling of bells keeps evil spirits away.
Strange Fears!: Superstitions explained.
ComicInfo.Title: The Crimes of the Black Cat; The Melody of Death; I Hired a Ghost!; The Case of the Deadly Dolls; Black Magic!; The Tree of Death!; Bells and Noises!; Strange Fears!
